intro: Brachyscome xanthocomoides, commonly known as the golden bristle bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Brachyscome xanthocomoides is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
